The lattice constant and density of NbMoTaW RHEA were firstly calculated to be 3.195 Å and 14.099 g/cm 3 based on the above models and parameters, respectively.

formula: NbMoTaWX (X = Cr, Zr, V, Hf, Re)
evidence: The yield stress of NbMoTaWX RHEAs increases by 10-66%. X V RHEA has the large yield strength and reaches about 1460 MPa. The peak stress is also increased up to 50% compared with that of NbMoTaW RHEA. X Zr RHEA has the maximum peak stress and reaches about 1822 MPa. The peak strain of X Zr RHEAs reaches about 15.9%, much larger than that of NbMoTaW RHEA.

formula: NbMoTaWX (X = Cr, Zr, V, Hf and Re)
evidence: Conclusion The phase structure, elastic properties, and electronic structure of alloyed NbMoTaWX (X = Cr, Zr, V, Hf and Re) RHEAs were predicted and the effect of alloying elements on the mechanical performance was investigated based on first-principle calculation and experiments. The δ, VEC, E f , and E c indicate that the alloyed NbMoTaWX RHEAs have a BCC single-phase solid solution structure. Most of the alloying elements (X = Cr, Zr, V, Hf and Re) enhanced the strength of NbMoTaW RHEA, while only Zr-alloying improved both the strength and ductility simultaneously. The strengthening mechanism was well analyzed based on the electronic structures. The formation of partial Zr-Zr metallic bonds effectively improved the strength and ductility of NbMoTaW RHEA from the perspective of experiments and theoretical predictions. The calculated results are in good agreement with the experimental data, which suggests an effective strategy for the strengthening of the NbMoTaW RHEA via alloying.
